ratings.comment: Very  unorganized.  With history especially, unless the broader context is thoroughly explained it seems just like random facts.  Also, the class would be better if it focused on specific countries in depth rather than attempting to cover all of Latin America.

She was a very nice, entertaining teacher but she was very unorganized. She was one of those teachers that is too smart and knows too much and doesn't know how to teach it to students not familiar with the topic. She gave out lecture outlines but never followed them and it made the class very confusing because it went all over the place.

Loved Prof. Mallon! Very interesting class and lecturer. Ran the class in 3 units with 5 weeks per unit. Paper after each unit and that was it besides weekly reading. TA was great too, which made the class great. I highly recommend taking a class with Mallon!

You may not realize it, but Mallon is one of the best professors you'll have at UW. She's a talented lecturer with an outstanding knowledge of the material she teachers. Definitely take any class you have the opportunity to with her.

Professor Mallon was a great lecturer who was very knowledgeable on Latin American history. She made what might seem to be a boring history lecture fun and interesting. She engaged the class with the right amount of questions, videoclips, and images to keep our attention. I would highly recommend History 242 to anyone who has an interest in LA.
Absolutely wonderful! You have to do the work, but she makes latin america so interesting, and the grading is very fair. not an ideal class for slackers.

Though this class is thought-provoking and emotion-stirring, I left this class extremely disappointed. I thought it quite tasteless that the class was made to buy her husband's garishly-written book and base 1/3 of the class material on it. Leaves a bad taste in the mouth. Overall, stimulating lectures and discussions.

Prof Mallon is passionate, hilarious, and approachable. She makes you think about Latin America in a new way. There is a lot of reading, but you don't necessarily need to finish every reading. This class is graded very fairly. I always looked forward to going to lecture! 3 papers, no exams. One of my favorite classes and professors at UW!

Whether you've got that revolutionary spirit or not this class is awesome! It'll make you question any previous ideas you had about revolutions in Latin America. Prof Mallon is incredibly passionate about the subject so even though it's a power lecture you won't get bored. The reading can be a lot sometimes but they're definitely worth it! Enjoy!
A very stimulating class--Florencia is awesome! I didn't personally enjoy the class due to my lack of interest in the subject matter but did, however, learn a lot.

Wonderful lecturer! her voice is fun to listen to and even in the humanities builing's uncomfy seats she can keep you alive. no midterms or finals, just three easy 5 page papers. get carrie for a TA if you can, she is awesome.

Did not expect the class to be as good as it was. Heavy reading load, but you learn a lot.  Mallon gives lectures really fast, but the discussion sections provide the opportunity to clarify anything missed.  She also stops periodically throughout lecture to clarify any questions. And she knows her stuff. Great class, but hard.

Amazing lecturer.  She's a fast talker, so you must take notes...also notice that there is no history book, so you must attend lecture to pass this course.  Gives you exam questions ahead of time, lets you use notes.  No memorization of anything.  Absolutely fascinating, loved the class!
She is an amazing professor.  She's actually from Chile, so if you are into Latin American Studies, you really ought to take her, really a fantastic professor!

Mallon has an extreme "Idea Per Minute" rate - she packs tons of info into every lecture, it's hard to keep up. Recommend taking ONLY after 242. Two essay exams with like 8 very difficult parts to them, one paper. Has a tendency to reshape how you think about LA completely. Work-really hard-you're fine. DO NOT take if you're interested in slacking!

Mallon talked very fast, and lectures were boring, but she was nice and very helpful. Discussions relied heavily on the books- lots of very boring readings! Participation in discussion is EVERYTHING. Midterm and final were easy though.
very arrogant; no time for students; misses office hours
fairly easy tests, easy to understand lectures
blah, blah, blah -- teach me some facts or theory; if i want morality tales, i'll take theology, philosophy, or drivers' education
Mallon knows her stuff! She is always willing to help you with questions. The class has a lot of reading and lectures are pretty fast-paced. Be prepared to apply yourself!

Extremely passionate about history... she LIVED it in Chile. Disagreements don't go over so well. Goes quickly through lectures, easy to get lost, but if you flag her down she'll clarify. Tries to incorporate outside stuff (movies, music) once a week, but a LOT of reading (four books, at least). Papers based off movies with little guidance given.
her lectures are not very good - stylistically. the information is interesting by not the way she presents it - sometimes she engaging but usually shes a little boring

The class is composed of two papers, a midterm, and a final. Gives the midterm and final exam questions out ahead of time and you can come in with outlines/notes. Tons of reading (100-150 pages a week). Very interesting, but be willing to work hard.

very engaging and passionate lecturer. mostly great readings -- not for whiners & slackers.  welcomes and integrates class input; responsive & helpful with questions (in class & office). 441 is incredible and a rewarding challenge.
Not very receptive to questions either in lecture or office hours
i really enjoyed the class. i learned a lot
A bit insane...
Very opinionated.  As striking as a Russian drag queen.
